tags
	- the command 'ruby tag_gen.rb' doesn't seem to be the key
	- the 'tag_gen.rb' file, however, is important
	- to add a new tag, you must cd to the jvcasill.github.io folder and then do 'jekyll build'
	- the new tag folder will be in the sites folder

Markdown to html
	- You can do it all directly in Rstudio and pandoc. Much easier. 
	- in order to get a custim layout, you have to link to the customslidy.css file:
	  <link rel="stylesheet" type="text/css" media="screen, projection, print"
     href="/bootstrap/css/customslidy.css" />
    - you can access this using the snippet "myslidy"
    - to get a specficic title page you need to change the div class to "slide titlepage". Heres an example:
    
    <div id="r-example-in-markdown" class="slide titlepage">
		<h1>R example in markdown</h1>
		<p>
			<a href="http://www.jvcasillas.com">Joseph Casillas,</a> <a href="mailto:jvcasill@email.arizona.edu">jvcasill@email.arizona.edu</a>
		</p> 
	</div> 

	- you can get this using the snippet "title"
